articles.author: Jess Phillips
articles.title: Boris Johnson is the worst prime minister of my lifetime – and I grew up under Thatcher
articles.description: I don’t know how the Conservative Party and its MPs have stomached his behaviour for so long
articles.content: He is finally gone and not a moment too soon. I never thought I would say this I am after all a Thatcher baby, born into a socialist home of union activists and feminist warriors but Boris Johnson is… [+4818 chars]

articles.description: The latest breaking news, comment and features from The Independent.
articles.content: Tom Peck is The Independent's Political Sketch Writer. He has also worked as a Political Correspondent, Sports Writer and Olympics Correspondent.

articles.author: Sean O'Grady
articles.title: If you thought Boris Johnson was bad, what’s to come will be even worse
articles.description: We might well not get that nice Jeremy Hunt or Tom Tugendhat in power, but an even more vindictive figure than Johnson instead
articles.content: This is about the Conservatives as well as Boris Johnson. Never forget either that we would not now be getting a new prime minister and a new government if Johnson hadnt fouled up the comms over the … [+6811 chars]

articles.author: Tom Peck
articles.title: Them’s not the breaks, prime minister, them’s the result of having no one to blame but yourself
articles.description: Never before has any such moment elicited such little basic human sympathy – he has got what he deserved
articles.content: As the Downing Street door opened and its downstairs toilet flushed out its familiar payload for the final time, its important to point out, in the interest of balance, that not everyone in the crowd… [+4591 chars]

articles.author: Andrew Grice
articles.title: Will Liz Truss succeed Boris Johnson? Expect the unexpected
articles.description: A leadership contest is more about who Tory MPs don’t want, than who they endorse as the next PM, writes Andrew Grice
articles.content: AConservative Party leadership election was under way long before Boris Johnson eventually bowed to the inevitable. Even before the Chris Pincher scandal became the straw that broke the partys back, … [+540 chars]

articles.author: Sunny Hundal
articles.title: Suella Braverman as our next prime minister? Be afraid, be very afraid
articles.description: She won’t just carry the torch for Brexit, she will wage a ‘war on woke’ while doing so
articles.content: If you thought Boris Johnson was an awful prime minister, wait until Suella Braverman gets a crack at the top job. Now that the hapless prime minister has resigned, a contest for the next Tory leader… [+3963 chars]

articles.author: Cathy Newman
articles.title: Defiant to the bitter end, until it was too late – how Boris Johnson became Britain’s Trump
articles.description: The prime minister resisted resigning until the very last, claiming he owed his mandate to the people, not the politicians – just as Donald Trump saw the mob outside the Capitol as ‘his people’
articles.content: It was Donald Trump who hailed Boris Johnson as a soulmate immediately after he won the leadership contest in July 2019. They call him Britain Trump, the former US president mused approvingly, with h… [+3905 chars]
